intro: Notylia lyrata, commonly known as the lyreleaf sedge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and grasses. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in dense clusters. Notylia lyrata typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
